name: Snyder's Potato Chips, Inc., Appellant, v. Hanover Canning Company
name_abbreviation: Snyder's Potato Chips, Inc. v. Hanover Canning Co.

judges: Before Bell, O. J., Jones, Cohen, Eagen, O’Beien, Robebts and Pomeboy, JJ.
Mr. Justice Cohen would vacate and remand.
parties: Snyder’s Potato Chips, Inc., Appellant, v. Hanover Canning Company.

opinions.text:
Opinion by
Mr. Chief Justice Bell,
Decree affirmed, each party to pay own costs.
Mr. Justice Cohen would vacate and remand.
opinions.author: Mr. Chief Justice Bell,

attorneys: Harold Cramer, with him Arthur N. Brandolph, and Mesirov, Celman, Jaffe & Levin, and Carrington Shields, of the Washington, D. C. Bar, for appellant.
W. Bradley Ward, with him Ira P. Tiger, Norman T. Petow, John R. Miller, and Schnader, Harrison, Se-gal é Lewis, for appellees.
casebody.head_matter:
Snyder’s Potato Chips, Inc., Appellant, v. Hanover Canning Company.
Argued January 22, 1969.
Before Bell, O. J., Jones, Cohen, Eagen, O’Beien, Robebts and Pomeboy, JJ.
April 23, 1969:
Harold Cramer, with him Arthur N. Brandolph, and Mesirov, Celman, Jaffe & Levin, and Carrington Shields, of the Washington, D. C. Bar, for appellant.
W. Bradley Ward, with him Ira P. Tiger, Norman T. Petow, John R. Miller, and Schnader, Harrison, Se-gal é Lewis, for appellees.
